Articles.Content:
...he is rather good and I want to see that or full of ...., which again from my personal experience with people is more likely.

Oooh Kasuha, you're being called-out. A link to your Return Eve Lander Twice in a single launch ship please, I can't find it and it's an amazing piece of work :-)

Corw - you picked the wrong person to doubt ^^.

He said and I quote "I have not run a refueling mission for ages".

He also said and I quote:

And in case I am really unsure, I just "run a simulation" which is IMO better experience than checking a table of numbers. Better support to running such experiments is what IMO the game needs more, too.

In other words, if it doesn't work he considers that a simulation and tries again. At least, that's what I mean when I say I'm "running a simulation" in quotes

I use KER and think it should be stock. However, I *could* eyeball at least a Gilly lander and return vehicle (I have done it) and I'm sure with a few tries I could get to any planet and back. Kashua is in the same boat only he has more experience doing it without KER's numbers than I do so where it'd take me a few tries he could have a good shot of doing it in one.

he is rather good and I want to see that or full of ....

It's option 1. He did Jool-5 in a spaceplane, for just one of many examples. I know he plays pure stock and I always assumed he was using an external tool for calculating delta-V, it is even more impressive to hear that he generally doesn't calculate it at all.

He also said and I quote:

In other words, if it doesn't work he considers that a simulation and tries again. At least, that's what I mean when I say I'm "running a simulation" in quotes

Sorry but that's just your unfounded assumption. I don't play that way.

Of course there's no way I can prove it except by giving you my word on it.

Regarding the Jool-5 Spaceplane mission, I did use quicksaves/quickloads on it. Not many, but I definitely needed them for Tylo landing. I am not that good. There's difference between doing possible but crazy stuff and running a safe and sound space program in Career.

Edited August 22, 2014 by Kasuha
Isn't it funny how suddenly there are much more votes for "Spaceplane +" after they announced that it is Spaceplane +?

Isn't it funny how suddenly there are much more votes for "Spaceplane +" after they announced that it is Spaceplane +?

I'm sure that's pure coincidence.

Isn't it funny how suddenly there are much more votes for "Spaceplane +" after they announced that it is Spaceplane +?

I still think we missed an opportunity by not including the Banana. I stand by my Banana vote!

Technically though, you could say that their votes are reflecting what they think it will be. I mean, I think it's going to be SPP now, and that Squad isn't going to troll us and actually switch to another one at the very last second or something.

Tuesday October 15, 2019 patch notes:

0.25 is live!

- Trolololol, SPP isn't the mod we're actually using. Say hello to... Banana!

...D'oh!

...that Squad isn't going to troll us and actually switch to another one at the very last second or something....

Regex - could you change the title of the thread to "Which other one"? (I'm kidding!)

I still think we missed an opportunity by not including the Banana. I stand by my Banana vote!

Of course, i voted banana too... but the small one in a canister!!! NOT the big structural one! It will just turn this game into a joke that i considered it to be for a long time ._.

...Tuesday October 15, 2019 patch notes:

0.25 is live!...

2019? You mean 2014 right?

OK, so Kasuha is the real deal. I apologize. But I still prefer to squeeze out the handling deficiencies on my test flights instead of trying to out how much delta v my rocket has (or can it lift from the launchpad at all in the first place). Iterative design trough explosions just to reach orbit was fun way back when, I'm out of that phase, it does not push my buttons any more.

2019? You mean 2014 right?

I'm totally not implying that the updates are kinda far in between, honest!

Besides that would be on a Wednesday.

DISCLAIMER: The bolded parts may or may not be lies.

Regex - could you change the title of the thread to "Which other one"? (I'm kidding!)

Heh! IMO this thread has run its course but I'm not about to ask for a lock.
